page.title: 06Religion
page.content: There is a Church of England Church in Netherwitton which shares the Vicar of Whalton with 4 other parishes. The electoral role consists of 30 people. The congregation is so small that all members are on the Parochial Parish Council which runs the Church and the Parish in conjunction with the Vicar. The Church is on an old 18th Century foundation, but apart from a small part it was rebuilt in Victorian times. It was originally the Chapel belonging to the Hall and the Chancel is still the property of the owner and looked after by him. The churchyard is now full and an extension 1/4 mile away across the stream has been in use since the 1920's. There are a few Methodists, Roman Catholics and Jehovah's Witnesses but nowhere for their community workshop.
